meanings.sent1: The judge legitimatized the contract by signing it.
meanings.sent2: The government legitimatized the new law by passing it through parliament.
meanings.sent3: The magician legitimatized the disappearing act by revealing the hidden trap door.
meanings.sent4: Her hard work legitimatized her place as the team captain.
meanings.sent5: The certificate of authenticity legitimatized the rare painting as a genuine masterpiece.

meanings.definition: To give official approval or recognition to.
meanings.sent1: The principal legitimatized the student council's decision to hold a charity event.
meanings.sent2: The committee legitimatized the research findings by publishing them in a reputable journal.
meanings.sent3: The dog legitimatized its title as the best fetch player in the park.
meanings.sent4: The royal seal legitimatized the decree as an official proclamation.
meanings.sent5: The badge of honor legitimatized his bravery in the eyes of his peers.
